results.title: Modern converter processes
results.creator_credit: Technical and Scientific Films, Film Producers Guild and Terrick Fitzhugh
results.brief_description: Traces the development of converters from the Bessemer converter to the modern oxygen converter processes used in the steel industry today. Describes the LD, LD/AC, Kaldo and Rotor processes. Chemical reactions are dealt with in animated sequences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Technical and Scientific Films, Film Producers Guild and Terrick Fitzhugh

results.title: Modern control of weeds
results.brief_description: The dangers of allowing weeds to grow unchecked, such as bush fires and obscured road signs, points to the need for an efficient and economical weedicide such as “Vorax”. Spraying evenly and thoroughly keeps railway lines, drains, kerbsides, tarmacs, footpaths, and cemetries clear for a whole season, without harm to nearby trees or children.

results.title: Modern Britain visits Australia
results.brief_description: Some of the 25 million pounds worth of goods put on display at the 1964 British Exhibition by the principal British companies associated with Australian companies in domestic and foreign trade. Includes the British Military Tournament held at the Sydney Showground.

results.title: Modern bread making
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, Peter Whitchurch and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: The whole process of bread making in a highly mechanised factory. Weighing and mixing the ingredients, the bread rising, mechanical cutting, moulding and oil spraying of the loaves; baking, slicing, wrapping and despatch. Presented by the bakers of Tip Top Bread.

results.title: Modern architecture in Japan
results.creator_credit: Nippon Technical Film Production Company and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Japanese architects are using traditional materials such as wood and bamboo in conjunction with concrete, steel, aluminium and glass, and are thereby creating a distinctive new architecture. Works of Mayikawa, Ashihara, Yoshida, Origuchi and Kenzo Tange are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nippon Technical Film Production Company and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs

results.title: Models of writing: reviewing television
results.brief_description: One of the great and universal styles of modern writing is the review, as everything from restaurants to motorcars are reviewed in the printed format. Television reviewer Jackie Stephen shares with the audience how she goes about the process of research and writing, the problems posed by different genres, and the constraints of writing for a family newspaper. Emphasis is placed on her review of the television comedy series “Hale and Pace”.

results.title: Model railroading unlimited
results.creator_credit: Liberty Pictures, Mike O'Connell and Rick Harper
results.brief_description: A young man’s growing interest in his hobby - model railroading - serves as the focus for comedy, intricate and elaborate layouts, and a climatic finale involving several trains running out of control on a super-sized track.
